AAT (Aachen Aphasia Test).name: AAT Reading Comprehesion
AAT (Aachen Aphasia Test).description: Aachen Aphasia Test Reading Comprehension correct. Reading comprehension of words & sentences. Higher score is better.

AAT (Aachen Aphasia Test).name: AAT Token Test Errors
AAT (Aachen Aphasia Test).description: Aachen Aphasia Test Token Test errors. Lower score is better. Identifies participants' ability to identify colors on verbal comand.

AAT (Aachen Aphasia Test).name: AAT Verbal Comprehesion
AAT (Aachen Aphasia Test).description: Aachen Apahsia Test Verbal Comprehension correct. Auditory comprehension of words & sentences. Higher score is better.

CABPad (Cognitive Assessment at Bedside.name: CABPAD - Normalized Total
CABPad (Cognitive Assessment at Bedside.description: CABPad (Cognitive Assessment at Bedside for iPad) is a short neuropsychological test battery for bedside screening for cognitive dysfunctions after stroke. Scoring: 0-55 Normalized scoring: 0-1

CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).name: CAT - Cognitive
CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).description: Cognitive total of the Comprehensive Aphasia Test Battery

CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).name: CAT - Naming
CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).description: Naming component of the Comprehensive Aphasia Test Battery

CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).name: CAT - Naming
CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).description: Total Naming (objects/action/fluecy) >69: part of the Comprehensive Aphasia battery

CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).name: CAT - Reading
CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).description: Total Reading score (58/70): part of the Comprehensive Aphasia battery

CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).name: CAT - Repetition
CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).description: Sub category of the comprehensive aphasia test battery

CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).name: CAT - Spoken Picture
CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).description: Subset of the Comprehensive Aphasia Test battery

CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).name: CAT - Total Spoken Language Comprehension
CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).description: Total comprehension of spoken language: part of the Comprehensive Aphasia battery

CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).name: CAT - Total Written Language Comprehension
CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).description: Total Comprehension of Written language: part of the Comprehensive Aphasia battery (53/62)

CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).name: CAT - Word Fluency
CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).description: Word fluency (Animals + S) (minimum 13), word fluency component of the Comprehensive Aphasia Test Battery

CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).name: CAT - Writing
CAT (Comprehensive Aphasia Test).description: Total Writing score (66/76): part of the Comprehensive Aphasia battery

CBB (Cogstate Brief Battery).name: CBB - Detection - Mean Reaction Time
CBB (Cogstate Brief Battery).description: Detection (simple reaction) task in Cogstate Brief Battery test. Mean reaction time (milliseconds)

CBB (Cogstate Brief Battery).name: CBB - Detection - Percent Correct
CBB (Cogstate Brief Battery).description: Detection (simple reaction) task in Cogstate Brief Battery test. Correct responses (percentage response)

CBB (Cogstate Brief Battery).name: CBB - Identification - Percent Correct
CBB (Cogstate Brief Battery).description: Identification (choice reaction) task in Cogstate Brief Battery test. Correct responses in percentage

CBB (Cogstate Brief Battery).name: CBB - Identificaton - Mean Reaction Time
CBB (Cogstate Brief Battery).description: Identification (choice reaction) task in Cogstate Brief Battery test. Mean reaction time (millseconds)

CBB (Cogstate Brief Battery).name: CBB - One Back - Mean Reaction Time
CBB (Cogstate Brief Battery).description: One-back task in Cogstate Brief Battery test. Mean reaction time

CBB (Cogstate Brief Battery).name: CBB - One Back - Percent Correct
CBB (Cogstate Brief Battery).description: One-back task in Cogstate Brief Battery test. Correct responses (percent)

Digit Span.name: Digit Span - Total
Digit Span.description: Total score of digit span forward and backward.

Digit Span.name: Digit Span - Backward
Digit Span.description: Digits Backward subtest from the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale - Third Edition (WAIS-III).

Digit Span.name: Digit Span - Forward
Digit Span.description: Digits Forward subtest from the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale - Third Edition (WAIS-III).

Digit Span.name: Digit Span - Sequencing
Digit Span.description: Digit span Digits Sequencing subtest of Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale - Third Edition (WAIS-III)

Digit Span.name: Digit Span - Total with Sequencing
Digit Span.description: Total score of digit span forward, backward, and sequencing subtests.

HVLT (Hopkins Verbal Learning Test).name: HVLT - Delay
HVLT (Hopkins Verbal Learning Test).description: HVLT: Hopkins Verbal Learning Test - consists of a 12-item word list, composed of four words from each of the three semantic categories. Delayed test checks no. of words recalled after a 20-25 minute delay.

HVLT (Hopkins Verbal Learning Test).name: HVLT - Recognition Discrimination Index
HVLT (Hopkins Verbal Learning Test).description: HVLT: Part of Hopkins Verbal Learning Tets: Recognition Discrimination Index is calculated as number of hits - number of false positives.

IRI (Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory).name: IRI - Empathic Concern
IRI (Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory).description: Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory empathic concern subscore. Self-report questionnaire measuring different aspects of empathy.

IRI (Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory).name: IRI - Fantasy
IRI (Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory).description: Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory fantasy subscore. Self-report questionnaire measuring different aspects of empathy.

IRI (Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory).name: IRI - Personal Distress
IRI (Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory).description: Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory personal distress subscore. Self-report questionnaire measuring different aspects of empathy.

IRI (Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory).name: IRI - Perspective
IRI (Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory).description: Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory perspective taking subscore. Self-report questionnaire measuring different aspects of empathy.

IRI (Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory).name: IRI - Total Without Personal Distress
IRI (Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory).description: Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory total score (without pd subscore items). Self-report questionnaire measuring different aspects of empathy.

None.name: Attention
None.description: Not speciffied - might be part of the 15-Short cognitive assessment?

None.name: BNT - Total
None.description: Boston Naming Test Score. The Boston Naming Test (BNT), is a measure of confrontation naming that takes into account the finding that patients who have greater difficulties with the naming of low frequency objects. Scoring: 0-60

None.name: BNT 15 - Total
None.description: Shortened Boston Naming Test score. The Boston Naming Test (BNT), is a measure of confrontation naming that takes into account the finding that patients who have greater difficulties with the naming of low frequency objects.

None.name: BVRT - Total
None.description: Benton Visual Retention Test correct score. Neuropsychological test used to assess visual perception, visual memory, & visuoconstructive abilities. It involves presenting visual stimuli (geometric figures) and then having the individual recall & reproduce them. Higher score is better for correct.

None.name: Clock Draw Test
None.description: Clock drawing task. Organisational score. Ex: pt sets time to "10 past 11".

None.name: Corsi Block Tapping - Total
None.description: Corsi Block-Tapping test. Assesses visuo-spatial short-term and working memory by requiring participants to mimic the tapping sequence of a researcher on a board with nine blocks. The immediate block span refers to the longest sequence of taps a person can correctly reproduce.

None.name: COWAT - Animals
None.description: Controlled oral word association test: number of animals, patient has to list the animals

None.name: COWAT - Words
None.description: Controlled oral word association test: number of words beginning with, F, A, S

None.name: CVLT - Total
None.description: California Verbal Learning Test total correct. Assesses verbal learning & memory by having participants learn & recall list of words.

None.name: Digit Symbol - Total
None.description: Digit symbol substitution task. Number of correct substitutions after 120 seconds.

None.name: Lines Cancellation
None.description: Screening tool used to detect the presence of unilateral spatial neglect. Scoring: 0-36

None.name: MMSE - Total
None.description: MMSE: Mini Mental Status Examination is a simple pen and paper test of cognitive function based on tests of orientation, concentration, attention, verbal memory, naming and visuospatial skills. Scoring: 0-30

None.name: MOCA - Total
None.description: MOCA: The Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) is a test used to detect mild cognitive decline and early signs of dementia. Scoring: 0-30

None.name: MWT Total
None.description: Mehrfachwahl-Wortschatz-Test Version B. Assessment of crystallized intelligence that is used for assessment of cognitive impairment. Assessment is a multiple choice vocabulary test, prominently used in Germany.

None.name: Neuro-QoL Total
None.description: Raw score of Cognitive Function component of Neuro-QoL assessment. See https://www.healthmeasures.net/images/neuro_qol/User_and_scoring_guides/Neuro-QOL_Scoring_Manual_26April2021_FINAL.pdf for interpretation

None.name: NeuroCogFX Go/NoGo Reaction Time
None.description: NeuroCoqFX Go NoGo reaction time. React Go on spacebar as fast as possible if blue circle appears & ignore yellow circles.

None.name: NeuroCogFX Inverted Go/NoGo Reaction Time
None.description: NeuroCoqFX inverted Go NoGo reaction time. React Go on spacebar as fast as possible if yellow circle appears and ignore blue circles.

None.name: NeuroCogFX Simple Reaction Time
None.description: NeuroCoqFX simple reaction time in ms. Participants react as fast as possible pressing spacebar when blue circle appears.

None.name: Phonological Fluency
None.description: Phonemic fluency. The total number of evoked words starting with the letters P, M, and R (60 seconds for each letter). Direct score.

None.name: RAVLT - Delayed
None.description: Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test. The number of words freely evoked after 20-30 minutes of learning.

None.name: RAVLT - Learning
None.description: Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test. The sum of trials 1 to 5 in the learning phase. Direct score.

None.name: SBT - Total
None.description: Total score of the Short Blessed Test (SBT), an assessment for cognitive impairment.

None.name: Star Cancellation Task
None.description: STAR CANCELLATION TASK

None.name: SVF - Total
None.description: Semantic Verbal Fluency (SVF) test entails the generation of words from a given category within a pre-set time of 60 seconds. Scoring: no. of words by the patient

None.name: Token Test - Total
None.description: TOKEN TEST (16-ITEM): used for checking verbal comprehension

None.name: TOPF - Total
None.description: Number of words correctly read using during the Test of Premorbid Function (TOPF). The purpose of the TOPF is to estimate preinjury intellectual ability.

None.name: Vocabulary
None.description: Test of vocabulary: site does not specify which one

None.name: WAIS - Matrix Reasoning
None.description: Matrix Reasoning subtest from the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale - Third Edition (WAIS-III). Direct score. Higher score means better performance. Scoring: 0-26

None.name: WAIT- Symbol Coding
None.description: Symbol Coding subtest from the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale - Third Edition (WAIS-III). Direct score.

RBANS (Repeatable Battery for the Assess.name: RBANS - Attention
RBANS (Repeatable Battery for the Assess.description: RBANS_A: Repeatable Battery for the Assessment of Neuropsychological Status (RBANS) - Attention: This index is a measure of simple auditory registration and visual scanning and processing speed. Low scores indicate difficulties with basic attention processes and speed of information processing.

RBANS (Repeatable Battery for the Assess.name: RBANS - Delayed
RBANS (Repeatable Battery for the Assess.description: RBANS_Delayed: This index is a measure of delayed recall and recognition for verbal and visual information. Low scores indicate difficulties with recognition and retrieval of information from long-term memory stores.

RBANS (Repeatable Battery for the Assess.name: RBANS - Immediate
RBANS (Repeatable Battery for the Assess.description: RBANS_Immediate: This index is a measure of initial encoding and learning of complex and simple verbal information. Low scores indicate difficulties with verbal learning.

RBANS (Repeatable Battery for the Assess.name: RBANS - Language
RBANS (Repeatable Battery for the Assess.description: RBANS_Language: This index is a measure of expressive language functioning. Low scores indicate difficulties with fluent use of language, including expressive and receptive language.

RBANS (Repeatable Battery for the Assess.name: RBANS - Version
RBANS (Repeatable Battery for the Assess.description: Version details of the RBANS: Repeatable Battery for the Assessment of Neuropsychological Status (RBANS) was developed for the dual purposes of identifying and characterizing abnormal cognitive decline in the older adult and as a neuropsychological screening battery.

RBANS (Repeatable Battery for the Assess.name: RBANS - Visuospatial
RBANS (Repeatable Battery for the Assess.description: RBANS_VS: This index is a measure of basic visuospatial perception and the ability to copy a design from a model. Low scores indicate difficulties with processing and using visuospatial information.

REY (Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test).name: Rey - Copy
REY (Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test).description: Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test. The precision of the copy. Total raw copy score.

REY (Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test).name: Rey - Copy Time
REY (Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test).description: Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test component. Total time taken to copy task in seconds.

REY (Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test).name: Rey - Delay Raw
REY (Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test).description: Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test component. Delayed Recall Score after 30 mins.

REY (Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test).name: Rey - Memory
REY (Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test).description: Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test component. The memory drawing accuracy at 3-5 minutes. Direct score.

REY (Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test).name: Rey - Org Raw
REY (Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test).description: Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Test component. Copy organizational score.

SCWT (Stroop Card and Word Test).name: Stroop - Card C
SCWT (Stroop Card and Word Test).description: Card C of the Stroop Color and Word Test. Named colors in 45 seconds. Direct score (non-corrected for age). Score = no. of colors patient can name is 45 seconds

SCWT (Stroop Card and Word Test).name: Stroop - Card CW
SCWT (Stroop Card and Word Test).description: Card CW of the Stroop Color and Word Test. Named colors in 45 seconds. Direct score (non-corrected for age).

SCWT (Stroop Card and Word Test).name: Stroop - Card W
SCWT (Stroop Card and Word Test).description: Card W of the Stroop Color and Word Test. Read words in 45 seconds. Direct score (non-corrected for age).

SCWT (Stroop Card and Word Test).name: Stroop - Interference Median
SCWT (Stroop Card and Word Test).description: Using Card CW of the Stroop Color and Word Test for coloured words, the medium value in seconds of the interference task (time needed to complete all items).

TMT (Trail Making Test).name: TMT - B/A Ratio
TMT (Trail Making Test).description: Trail Making Test Part B score divided by Trail Making Test Part A score

TMT (Trail Making Test).name: TMT - Part A
TMT (Trail Making Test).description: Trail Making Test Part A. Seconds to complete the numerical sequence. Direct score. More time indicates worse performance.

TMT (Trail Making Test).name: TMT - Part B
TMT (Trail Making Test).description: Trail Making Test Part B. Seconds to complete the numerical sequence. Direct score. More time indicates worse performance.

None.name: Age
None.description: Person's Age

None.name: Days Post Stroke
None.description: No. of days since patient had the stroke

None.name: Sex
None.description: Sex of the subject

None.name: Affected Side
None.description: Affected side post stroke. Sometimes referred to as the paretic side. Also recommended pulling LESIONED_HEMISPHERE if querying for this metric.

None.name: Alcohol Consumption
None.description: Current alcohol consumption in standard drink units within a week.

None.name: Aphasia
None.description: Presence of aphasia symptoms at baseline

None.name: Atrial Fibrillation
None.description: Atrial Fibrillation: Atrial fibrillation (Afib) is an irregular heart rhythm. Cardiovascular risk factor for stroke.

None.name: BMI
None.description: Body-mass index is a ratio between body weight and height, typically used to assess obesity.

None.name: Carotid Stenosis
None.description: Carotid Stenosis: narrowing of the carotid artery, cardiovascular risk factor,

None.name: Chronicity
None.description: Stage of stroke when exact days post stroke is unknown. Typically mirrors the acute, early subacute, late subacute, and chronic stages of stroke

None.name: COPD
None.description: COPD: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disorder; a respiratory complication Can be present or absent (0 or 1)

None.name: Coronary Artery Disease
None.description: Coronary Artery Disease: Cardiovascular risk factor, can be present or absent. Scoring options: 0 or 1

None.name: Date of Birth
None.description: Date of Birth of the patient

None.name: Date of Stroke
None.description: Date on which patient had stroke (formatted as MM/DD/YYYY)

None.name: Days in Hospital
None.description: No. of days patient was admitted in the hospital for

None.name: Diabetes
None.description: Diabetes is a chronic disease that occurs either when the pancreas does not produce enough insulin or when the body cannot effectively use the insulin it produces. Risk factor for stroke.

None.name: Discharge Destination
None.description: Destination to which the patient was discharged.

None.name: Education
None.description: No. of years of education completed by the individual (e.g. high school = 12 years)

None.name: Ethnicity
None.description: Ethnicity of the individual

None.name: First Stroke
None.description: Whether is it the patient's first stroke or not (yes or no)

None.name: Gender
None.description: Gender of the person

None.name: Handedness
None.description: Dominant hand of the individual

None.name: Handedness Post-Stroke
None.description: Handedness after the stroke

None.name: Handedness Pre-Stroke
None.description: Dominant side of the individual (left =1, right =2) Can also be 0, 1

None.name: High cholesterol
None.description: Presence of high cholesterol, a cardiovascular risk factor for stroke

None.name: Hypertension
None.description: Presence of hypertension, a cardiovascular risk factor for stroke

None.name: Intervention
None.description: Indicates whether subject had an intervention or not

None.name: Intervention Notes
None.description: Information about the intervention

None.name: Motor Paresis
None.description: Presence of motor paresis

None.name: Myocardial Infarction
None.description: History of myocardial infarction

None.name: Number of Strokes
None.description: Number of strokes the patient has had

None.name: Patient/Control Identifier
None.description: Patient control group

None.name: Peak Oxygen Consumption
None.description: Normalized (by age and sex) oxygen consumption in percentage

None.name: Peak Oxygen Consumption
None.description: Peak oxygen consumption (normalized per kilogram, per minute) in milliliters

None.name: Peripheral Arterial Occlusive Disease
None.description: History of peripheral arterial occlusive disease (pACD)

None.name: Race
None.description: Racial identity of the person

None.name: Scan Date
None.description: Date of MRI scan (formatted as MM/DD/YYYY)

None.name: Smoking - Cigarettes Per Day
None.description: Current number of cigarettes within a day

None.name: Smoking - Cigarettes Per Pack-Years
None.description: Number of cigarette in pack-years. Pack-year is equal to number of packs per day times the number of years smoked.

None.name: Smoking Status
None.description: Whether person currently or has ever smoked (1) or not (0)

None.name: Stroke Type
None.description: Type of stroke. If more than one stroke, information presented corresponds to the most recent one. 1 = Hemorrhagic, 2 = Ischemic

None.name: TOAST Classification
None.description: Classification of ischemic stroke etiology as determined by the TOAST (Trial of Org 10172 in Acute Stroke Treatment) classification system.

None.name: tPA
None.description: Whether patient was treated with tPA (tissue plasminogen activator)

None.name: Transient Ischemic Attack
None.description: History of transient ischemic attack

None.name: Treatment Group
None.description: Treatment group details: site assigned

None.name: Waist-Hip Ratio
None.description: Waist-hip ratio (WHR) compares waist and hip circumference to assess body fat distribution.

BODS (Bogenhausen Dysphagia Score).name: BODS (Admission)
BODS (Bogenhausen Dysphagia Score).description: Sum of Bogenhausen Dysphagia Score (BODS) at admission. BODS is used to assess swallowing ability. A score of 3 or higher indicates dysphagia. A score of 3-9 is considered moderate dysphagia, and a score of 10-16 is considered severe dysphagia. Scoring information was collected from Keser T, Kofler M, Katzmayr M, et al. Risk Factors for Dysphagia and the Impact on Outcome After Spontaneous Subarachnoid Hemorrhage. Neurocrit Care. 2020;33(1):132-139. doi:10.1007/s12028-019-00874-6.

BODS (Bogenhausen Dysphagia Score).name: BODS (Discharge)
BODS (Bogenhausen Dysphagia Score).description: Sum of Bogenhausen Dysphagia Score (BODS) at admission. BODS is used to assess swallowing ability. A score of 3 or higher indicates dysphagia. A score of 3-9 is considered moderate dysphagia, and a score of 10-16 is considered severe dysphagia. Scoring information was collected from Keser T, Kofler M, Katzmayr M, et al. Risk Factors for Dysphagia and the Impact on Outcome After Spontaneous Subarachnoid Hemorrhage. Neurocrit Care. 2020;33(1):132-139. doi:10.1007/s12028-019-00874-6.

CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).name: CFQ11 - Total
CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).description: Chalder Fatigue Scale, a self-administered scale that measures extent and severity of fatigue. Scoring: 0-33

CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).name: CFQ11 - Acute
CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).description: Acute component of Chalder Fatigue Scale, a self-administered scale that measures extent and severity of fatigue.

CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).name: CFQ11 - Chronic
CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).description: Chronic component of Chalder Fatigue Scale, a self-administered scale that measures extent and severity of fatigue.

CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).name: CFQ11 - Likert
CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).description: Likert score of Chalder Fatigue Scale, a self-administered scale that measures extent and severity of fatigue.

CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).name: CFQ11 - Mental
CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).description: Mental component of Chalder Fatigue Scale, a self-administered scale that measures extent and severity of fatigue.

CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).name: CFQ11 - Physical
CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).description: Physical component of Chalder Fatigue Scale, a self-administered scale that measures extent and severity of fatigue.

CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).name: CFQ11 - VAS
CFQ11 (Chalder Fatigue Scale).description: Chalder Fatigue Scale: self-administered scale, measures extent and severity of fatigue. VAS (visual analogue scale) component measures the extent of chronic pain.

IRF-PAI (Inpatient Rehabilitation Facili.name: IRF-PAI - Dress Lower Body
IRF-PAI (Inpatient Rehabilitation Facili.description: Score for the "Dress Lower Body" (GG0130G) component of the Inpatient Rehabilitation Facility Patient Assessment Instrument (IRF-PAI). See https://udsmrweb.udsmr.org/UDSCentral2015/Documents/QICredentialing/IRF-PAI%20Manual%20Section%20GG%20Funtional%20Abilities%20and%20Goals%20%28Self%20Care%20and%20Mobility%29%20%20Version%203.0,%20Effective%20Octboer%201,%202019.pdf

IRF-PAI (Inpatient Rehabilitation Facili.name: IRF-PAI - Dress Upper Body
IRF-PAI (Inpatient Rehabilitation Facili.description: Score for the "Dress Upper Body" (GG0130F) component of the Inpatient Rehabilitation Facility Patient Assessment Instrument (IRF-PAI). See https://udsmrweb.udsmr.org/UDSCentral2015/Documents/QICredentialing/IRF-PAI%20Manual%20Section%20GG%20Funtional%20Abilities%20and%20Goals%20%28Self%20Care%20and%20Mobility%29%20%20Version%203.0,%20Effective%20Octboer%201,%202019.pdf

IRF-PAI (Inpatient Rehabilitation Facili.name: IRF-PAI - Sit to Stand
IRF-PAI (Inpatient Rehabilitation Facili.description: Score for the "Sit to Stand" (GG0170D) component of the Inpatient Rehabilitation Facility Patient Assessment Instrument (IRF-PAI). See https://udsmrweb.udsmr.org/UDSCentral2015/Documents/QICredentialing/IRF-PAI%20Manual%20Section%20GG%20Funtional%20Abilities%20and%20Goals%20%28Self%20Care%20and%20Mobility%29%20%20Version%203.0,%20Effective%20Octboer%201,%202019.pdf

IRF-PAI (Inpatient Rehabilitation Facili.name: IRF-PAI - Walk 150 Feet
IRF-PAI (Inpatient Rehabilitation Facili.description: Score for the "Walk 150 Feet" (GG0170K) component of the Inpatient Rehabilitation Facility Patient Assessment Instrument (IRF-PAI). See https://udsmrweb.udsmr.org/UDSCentral2015/Documents/QICredentialing/IRF-PAI%20Manual%20Section%20GG%20Funtional%20Abilities%20and%20Goals%20%28Self%20Care%20and%20Mobility%29%20%20Version%203.0,%20Effective%20Octboer%201,%202019.pdf

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Total
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS): Measures the severity of symptoms associated with cerebral infarcts; used as a quantitative measure of neurological deficit post stroke.

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Normalized Total
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Normed value of NIHSS score

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Motor Total
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Motor component of the NIHSS - sum of items 4, 5a, 5b, 6a, 6b

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Normalized Motor Total
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Normalized motor component of the NIHSS - sum of items 4, 5a, 5b, 6a, 6b

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Admission
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: NIHSS score at admission or within 2 hours after thrombolysis if thrombolysed

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Baseline
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: NIHSS score at baseline

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Best Gaze
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 2 (Best gaze)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Best Language
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 9 (Best language)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Discharge
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: NIHSS score at discharge

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Dysarthria
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 10 (Dysarthria)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Extinction and Inattention
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 11 (Extinction and inattention)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Facial Palsy
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 4 (Facial palsy)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Level of Consciousness
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 1a (Level of consciousness)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Level of Consciousness Command
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 1c (Level of consciousness command)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Level of Consciousness Questions
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 1b (Level of consciousness questions)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Limb Ataxia
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 7 (Limb ataxia)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Motor Arm - Left
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 5a (Motor arm - Left arm)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Motor Arm - Right
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 5b (Motor arm - Right arm)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 6a (Motor leg - Left leg)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Sensory
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 8 (Sensory)

NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).name: NIHSS - Visual
NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale).description: Score for NIH Stroke Scale Item 3 (Visual)

None.name: Apraxia
None.description: Apraxia is the loss of ability to execute or carry out skilled movement and gestures, despite having the physical ability and desire to perform them. Can be present or absent (e.g. 0 or 1)

None.name: CCI - Total
None.description: Total score of Charlson Comorbidity Index (CCI), an assessment used to predict 10 year survival in patients with multiple comorbidities.

None.name: EQ5D-5L - Total
None.description: Score for EQ-5D 5L questionnaire, which assesses self-rating of health.

None.name: Fatigue Severity Scale
None.description: The 9-item scale which measures the severity of fatigue and its effect on a person's activities and lifestyle in patients with a variety of disorders. Higher the score = greater fatigue severity.

None.name: MBI - Total
None.description: Modified Barthel Index: measure of physical disability used widely to assess behaviour relating to activities of daily living for stroke patients or patients with other disabling conditions. Score: 0-100

None.name: PSQI - Total
None.description: Score for the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI), with higher scores suggesting poorer sleep quality.

None.name: SSEQ - Total
None.description: The SSEQ: Stroke Self Efficacy Questionnaire is a 13-item self-report scale measuring self-efficacy judgements and conficence in specific domains of functioning post stroke. Individuals rate their belief in their ability to achieve each of the 13 items on a 10-point scale, where 0 = not at all confident to 10 = very confident

SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).name: SIS - ADL
SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).description: Activities of Daily Living domain of the Stroke Impact Scale. The Stroke Impact Scale (SIS) is a self-report questionnaire that evaluates disability and health-related quality of life after stroke. 8 domains assessed: 1) Strength (4 items); 2) Hand function (5 items); 3) ADL/IADL (10 items); 4) Mobility (9 items); 5) Communication (7 items); 6) Emotion (9 items); 7) Memory and thinking (7 items); 8) Participation/Role function (8 items)

SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).name: SIS - Mean Total
SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).description: The Stroke Impact Scale (SIS) is a self-report questionnaire that evaluates disability and health-related quality of life after stroke. This score is the mean value of all items across the 8 domains assessed: 1) Strength (4 items); 2) Hand function (5 items); 3) ADL/IADL (10 items); 4) Mobility (9 items); 5) Communication (7 items); 6) Emotion (9 items); 7) Memory and thinking (7 items); 8) Participation/Role function (8 items)

SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).name: SIS - Normalized Total
SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).description: Normed value of Stroke Impact Scale. The Stroke Impact Scale (SIS) is a self-report questionnaire that evaluates disability and health-related quality of life after stroke. 8 domains assessed: 1) Strength (4 items); 2) Hand function (5 items); 3) ADL/IADL (10 items); 4) Mobility (9 items); 5) Communication (7 items); 6) Emotion (9 items); 7) Memory and thinking (7 items); 8) Participation/Role function (8 items)

SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).name: SIS - Total
SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).description: The Stroke Impact Scale (SIS) is a self-report questionnaire that evaluates disability and health-related quality of life after stroke. 8 domains assessed: 1) Strength (4 items); 2) Hand function (5 items); 3) ADL/IADL (10 items); 4) Mobility (9 items); 5) Communication (7 items); 6) Emotion (9 items); 7) Memory and thinking (7 items); 8) Participation/Role function (8 items)

SSQOL (Stroke-Specific Quality of Life).name: SSQOL - Mean
SSQOL (Stroke-Specific Quality of Life).description: SSQOL: Stroke Specific Quality of Life Scale: The SS-QOL assesses health-related quality of life specific to stroke survivors. The 12 domains include: 1) Mobility 2) Energy 3) Upper Extremity Function 4) Work and Productivity 5) Mood 6) Self-care 7) Social Roles 8) Family Roles 9) Vision 10) Language 11) Thinking 12) Personality Total scoring: 49-245

SSQOL (Stroke-Specific Quality of Life).name: SSQOL - Self Care Mean
SSQOL (Stroke-Specific Quality of Life).description: Selfcare component mean of the SSQOL

SSQOL (Stroke-Specific Quality of Life).name: SSQOL - Upper Extremity Function Mean
SSQOL (Stroke-Specific Quality of Life).description: Upper extremity component mean of the SSQOL

mRS (Modified Rankin Scale).name: mRS - Total
mRS (Modified Rankin Scale).description: The Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) is used to measure the degree of disability in patients who have had a stroke. Higher scores indicates more global disability. Scoring: 0-6 (latest version)

mRS (Modified Rankin Scale).name: mRS - Follow-up
mRS (Modified Rankin Scale).description: Follow-up Modified Rankin Scale score. The Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) is used to measure the degree of disability in patients who have had a stroke. Higher scores indicates more global disability. Scoring: 0-6 (latest version)

mRS (Modified Rankin Scale).name: mRS - Follow-up Days since Baseline
mRS (Modified Rankin Scale).description: Number of days after baseline the Follow-up Modified Rankin Scale was performed. The Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) is used to measure the degree of disability in patients who have had a stroke. Higher scores indicates more global disability. Scoring: 0-6 (latest version)

None.name: Lesioned Hemisphere - Details
None.description: Details on the lesion site

None.name: Lesioned Hemisphere - NPNL
None.description: Lesioned hemisphere as reported by NPNL after tracing

Motricity.name: Motricity - Affected - Leg
Motricity.description: Test for assessing motor function - Upper Extremity tests: shoulder abduction, elbow flexion, pinch grip Lower Extremity tests: hip flexion, knee extension, dorsiflexion

Motricity.name: Motricity - Nonaffected - Leg
Motricity.description: Test for assessing motor function - Upper Extremity tests: shoulder abduction, elbow flexion, pinch grip Lower Extremity tests: hip flexion, knee extension, dorsiflexion

None.name: 10 Meter Walk Test - Maximal Walk Speed
None.description: Score for the Ten Meter Walk Test, assessing the maximal walking speed of the individual.

None.name: 10 Meter Walk Test - Preferred Walk Speed
None.description: Score for the Ten Meter Walk Test, assessing the preferred walking speed of the individual.

None.name: 6 Minute Walk Test
None.description: The 6-minute walk test (6MWT) is a sub-maximal exercise test that assesses aerobic capacity and endurance. During the test, you walk as far as you can in six minutes. The 6MWT can be used in preschool children (2-5 years), children (6-12 years) adults (18-64 years), elderly adults (65+) with a range of diagnoses. Also checks for balance, postural deficits, gait etc.

None.name: ABC Total Score
None.description: Activities-Specific Balance Confidence Scale: The ABC Scale is a self-report measure of balance confidence in performing various activities without losing balance or experiencing a sense of unsteadiness.

None.name: Berg Balance Scale Total
None.description: The Berg Balance Scale (BBS) is used to objectively determine a patient's ability (or inability) to safely balance during a series of predetermined tasks. Scoring: 0-56

None.name: DGI - Total
None.description: DGI (Dynamic Gait Index). Developed to assess the likelihood of falling in older adults. Designed to test eight facets of gait.

None.name: FAC
None.description: Score for the Functional Ambulatory Category, which assesses functional ambulance in patients.

None.name: FGA Total
None.description: The FGA is used to assess postural stability during walking and assesses an individual's ability to perform multiple motor tasks while walking. The tool is a modification of the 8-item Dynamic Gait Index.

None.name: FMLE - Total
None.description: Fugl Meyer Assessment Motor Component for the Lower Extremity. Fugl Meyer Assessment (FM) evaluates and measures recovery in post-stroke hemiplegic patients.

None.name: Overground Walking Speed
None.description: Over-ground Self-selected Walking Speeds (cm/s)

None.name: Sit to Stand Test
None.description: The Five Times Sit to Stand Test measures one aspect of transfer skill. The test provides a method to quantify functional lower extremity strength and/or identify movement strategies a patient uses to complete transitional movements. Scoring: Time taken in seconds

ARAT (Action Research Arm Test).name: ARAT - Total
ARAT (Action Research Arm Test).description: The Action Research Arm Test (ARAT) is a 19-item measure aimed at assessing functional performance of the upper extremity through observational means. Score: 0-57. Score typically represent the paretic side.

BBT (Box and Blocks Test).name: BBT - Affected side
BBT (Box and Blocks Test).description: Box and Block Test of the affected side: assesses unilateral gross manual dexterity. Also checks for Activities of Daily Living, Coordination, Dexterity, Upper Extremity Function. Score is based on no. of blocks transferred in 60 seconds. Average of the trials Scoring - e.g. can be integer (46) or decimal (46.5)

BBT (Box and Blocks Test).name: BBT - Left side
BBT (Box and Blocks Test).description: Box and Block Test of the left hand side: assesses unilateral gross manual dexterity. Also checks for Activities of Daily Living, Coordination, Dexterity, Upper Extremity Function. Score is based on no. of blocks transferred in 60 seconds. Average of the trials Scoring - e.g. can be integer (46) or decimal (46.5)

BBT (Box and Blocks Test).name: BBT - Non-Affected side
BBT (Box and Blocks Test).description: Box and Block Test of the non-affected side: assesses unilateral gross manual dexterity. Also checks for Activities of Daily Living, Coordination, Dexterity, Upper Extremity Function. Score is based on no. of blocks transferred in 60 seconds. Average of the trials Scoring - e.g. can be integer (46) or decimal (46.5)

BBT (Box and Blocks Test).name: BBT - Normalized
BBT (Box and Blocks Test).description: Box and Block Test: assesses unilateral gross manual dexterity. Also checks for Activities of Daily Living, Coordination, Dexterity, Upper Extremity Function. Score is based on no. of blocks transferred in 60 seconds. Average of the trials Normalized Score: 0-1

BBT (Box and Blocks Test).name: BBT - Right side

GPT (Grooved Pegboard Test).name: Grooved Pegboard Test - Purdue - Affected
GPT (Grooved Pegboard Test).description: Measures fine and gross motor dexterity and coordination in the upper extremity for the affected side. Scoring is measured by time in seconds for right, left, both hands and assembly of the different washers/ pegs.

GPT (Grooved Pegboard Test).name: Grooved Pegboard Test - Purdue - Nonaffected

GPT (Grooved Pegboard Test).name: Grooved Pegboard Test - Scaled

GPT (Grooved Pegboard Test).name: Grooved Pegboard Test - Total
GPT (Grooved Pegboard Test).description: The Grooved Pegboard Test (GPT) is used primarily as a measure of motor functioning. Manipulative dexterity, including finger speed, is assessed. Total score = time in seconds

None.name: Normalized Motor Score
None.description: Normalized motor score to harmonize across scales

None.name: Normalized Motor Score - Source
None.description: Scale used to calculate normalized motor score (e.g. FMUE, Box and blocks test)

None.name: Normalized Motor Score - Control
None.description: Normalized motor score for the control group to harmonize across scales

None.name: 9-Hole Peg Test - Affected
None.description: Nine Hole Peg Test for the Affected side. The Nine Hole Peg Test (NHPT) was developed to measure finger dexterity, also known as fine manual dexterity. The NHPT is composed of a square board with 9 pegs. Scoring: time taken (in seconds) to complete the activity.

None.name: 9-Hole Peg Test - Nonaffected
None.description: Nine Hole Peg Test for the Non-affected side. The Nine Hole Peg Test (NHPT) was developed to measure finger dexterity, also known as fine manual dexterity. The NHPT is composed of a square board with 9 pegs. Scoring: time taken (in seconds) to complete the activity.

None.name: EHI - Total
None.description: The Edinburgh Handedness Inventory (EHI), sometimes referred to as the Edinburgh Handedness Questionnaire (EHQ), objectively ascertains the handedness of a subject in activities of daily living (ADL). Most commonly used screening tool for handedness in stroke. Scoring : -100 = pure left handed, +100 = pure right handed

None.name: Fingertap - Affected Side
None.description: Assessment of dexterity, patient is asked to finger tap for around 10 to 15 seconds for as quickly and widely as they can. A = Affected side

None.name: Fingertap - Nonaffected Side
None.description: Assessment of dexterity, patient is asked to finger tap for around 10 to 15 seconds for as quickly and widely as they can. NA = Non-Affected side

None.name: JTHFT - Normalized Total
None.description: Normalized Jebsen Taylor Hand Function Test score. The Jebsen Taylor Hand Function Test (JTHFT) is a standardized and objective measure of fine and gross motor hand function using simulated activities of daily living (ADL).

None.name: MAL - Mean
None.description: Mean of the Motor Activity Log

None.name: MAL - Total
None.description: The MAL is a semi-structured interview to assess arm function. MAL 28 assesses using 28 functional tasks. Scoring is on a 5-point scale.

None.name: MMT - Normalized Total
None.description: Normalized total score for Manual Motor Test (MMT).

None.name: Motor Sequencies
None.description: Test for upper limb apraxia

None.name: Pinch Strength - Affected
None.description: Pinch strength of the affected side (in kgs)

None.name: Pinch Strength - Nonaffected
None.description: Pinch strength of the non-affected side (in kgs)

None.name: Pinch Strength - Normalized
None.description: Normed value of the pinch strength

None.name: REPAS - Affected
None.description: Summary rating scale for resistance to passive movement. REPAS is based on the Ashworth scale, a common clinical standard measure of spasticity in patients with central paresis

None.name: REPAS - Nonaffected
None.description: Summary rating scale for resistance to passive movement. REPAS is based on the Ashworth scale, a common clinical standard measure of spasticity in patients with central paresis

None.name: RITHMS - Test
None.description: Site does not provide description, also unable to find

None.name: RMI - Arm
None.description: Score for the Rivermead Mobility Index (RMI) arm component, where higher scores indicate better functional mobility

None.name: Unilateral Neglect
None.description: Presence of unilateral neglect (0 = absent, 1 = present)

SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).name: SIS - Hand Function
SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).description: Hand Functions domain of the Stroke Impact Scale. The Stroke Impact Scale (SIS) is a self-report questionnaire that evaluates disability and health-related quality of life after stroke. 8 domains assessed: 1) Strength (4 items); 2) Hand function (5 items); 3) ADL/IADL (10 items); 4) Mobility (9 items); 5) Communication (7 items); 6) Emotion (9 items); 7) Memory and thinking (7 items); 8) Participation/Role function (8 items)

SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).name: SIS - Mean Hand Function
SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).description: Mean value of Hand functions domain of the Stroke Impact Scale. The Stroke Impact Scale (SIS) is a self-report questionnaire that evaluates disability and health-related quality of life after stroke. 8 domains assessed: 1) Strength (4 items); 2) Hand function (5 items); 3) ADL/IADL (10 items); 4) Mobility (9 items); 5) Communication (7 items); 6) Emotion (9 items); 7) Memory and thinking (7 items); 8) Participation/Role function (8 items)

SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).name: SIS - Normalized Hand Function
SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).description: Normed value of Hand functions domain of the Stroke Impact Scale. The Stroke Impact Scale (SIS) is a self-report questionnaire that evaluates disability and health-related quality of life after stroke. 8 domains assessed: 1) Strength (4 items); 2) Hand function (5 items); 3) ADL/IADL (10 items); 4) Mobility (9 items); 5) Communication (7 items); 6) Emotion (9 items); 7) Memory and thinking (7 items); 8) Participation/Role function (8 items)

SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).name: SIS - Percentile Normalized Hand Function
SIS (Stroke Impact Scale).description: Normed value of Hand functions domain of the Stroke Impact Scale, reported as a percentage. The Stroke Impact Scale (SIS) is a self-report questionnaire that evaluates disability and health-related quality of life after stroke. 8 domains assessed: 1) Strength (4 items); 2) Hand function (5 items); 3) ADL/IADL (10 items); 4) Mobility (9 items); 5) Communication (7 items); 6) Emotion (9 items); 7) Memory and thinking (7 items); 8) Participation/Role function (8 items)

Motricity.description: Test for assessing motor function - Upper Extremity tests: shoulder abduction, elbow flexion, pinch grip Lower Extremity tests: hip flexion, knee extension, dorsiflexion

None.name: FM - Normalized Total
None.description: Fugl Meyer Assessment Motor Component Normalized Score. Fugl Meyer Assessment (FM) evaluates and measures recovery in post-stroke hemiplegic patients. Combines score for upper extremity (UE) and lower extremity (LE), then normalizes by dividing by maximum possible score. UE score ranges from 0-66, while LE score ranges from 0-34.

None.name: FM - Total - All Domains
None.description: Fugl Meyer Assessment All Domains Total Score. Fugl Meyer Assessment (FM) evaluates and measures recovery in post-stroke hemiplegic patients. The Five domains assessed include 1) Motor function (UE maximum score = 66; LE maximum score = 34); 2) Sensory function (maximum score = 24); 3) Balance (maximum score = 14); 4) Joint range of motion (maximum score = 44); 5) Joint pain (maximum score = 44). Scoring: 0-226 (all domains)

None.name: FM - Total - Upper and Lower Extremity
None.description: Fugl Meyer Assessment Motor Component Total Score. Fugl Meyer Assessment (FM) evaluates and measures recovery in post-stroke hemiplegic patients. Combines score for upper extremity (UE) and lower extremity (LE). UE score ranges from 0-66, while LE score ranges from 0-34.

None.name: REPAS - Total
None.description: Sum of REPAS scores at 8 UE joints & 5 LE joints

None.name: RMI - Total
None.description: Score for the Rivermead Mobility Index (RMI), where higher scores indicate better functional mobility

BDI (Beck Depression Inventory).name: BDI - Psychological
BDI (Beck Depression Inventory).description: The Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) is a 21-item, self-report rating inventory that measures characteristic attitudes and symptoms of depression. Scoring: 0-15

BDI (Beck Depression Inventory).name: BDI - Somatic
BDI (Beck Depression Inventory).description: The Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) is a 21-item, self-report rating inventory that measures characteristic attitudes and symptoms of depression. Scoring: 0-15

BDI (Beck Depression Inventory).name: BDI - Total
BDI (Beck Depression Inventory).description: Beck Depression Inventory (BDI): Total of depression and SOM components

CES-D (Center for Epidemiologic Studies.name: CES-D - Lie
CES-D (Center for Epidemiologic Studies.description: Total LIE score for Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale. If CESD_LIE is under -28, CESD_SUM is thought to be unreliable.

CES-D (Center for Epidemiologic Studies.name: CES-D - Pre-Lie Total
CES-D (Center for Epidemiologic Studies.description: Total score of Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale sum before considering CESD_LIE

CES-D (Center for Epidemiologic Studies.name: CES-D - Total
CES-D (Center for Epidemiologic Studies.description: Total score for the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CES-D), where higher scores suggest more symptomology. TOTAL incorporates information from CESD_SUM and CESD_LIE.

DAS-21 (Depression Anxiety Stress Scale).name: DAS-21 - Anxiety
DAS-21 (Depression Anxiety Stress Scale).description: Anxiety subscale from the Depression Anxiety Stress Scale-21 items. Direct score.

DAS-21 (Depression Anxiety Stress Scale).name: DAS-21 - Depression
DAS-21 (Depression Anxiety Stress Scale).description: Depression subscale from the Depression Anxiety Stress Scale-21 items. Direct score.

DAS-21 (Depression Anxiety Stress Scale).name: DAS-21 - Stress
DAS-21 (Depression Anxiety Stress Scale).description: Stress subscale from the Depression Anxiety Stress Scale-21 items. Direct score.

None.name: FBI - Total
None.description: FBI: Frontal Behavioral Inventory is a 24-item inventory designed to assess behavior and personality changes associated with the behavioral variant of frontotemporal dementia via caregiver report. Item-level scores: (0 = never, 1 = mild or occasional, 2 = moderate, 3 = severe or very frequent)

None.name: GAD7 - Total
None.description: GAD: GENERALISED ANXIETY DISORDER QUESTIONNAIRE 7-ITEM

None.name: GAI - Total
None.description: Score for Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7 (GAD7). Higher scores suggest presence of more symptomology.

None.name: GDS - Total
None.description: GDS: Geriatric Depression Scale - Assesses depression and suicide ideation in elderly individuals. Scoring: 0-30. Score greater than 11 indicates depression

None.name: HAM - Anxiety
None.description: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale (HAM-A). The HAM-A measures the severity of anxiety symptoms. Total score: 0-56, where <17 indicates mild severity, 18-24 mild to moderate severity and 25-30 moderate to severe.

None.name: HAM - Depression
None.description: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D). The HAM-D is a clinician-administered depression assessment scale. Scoring interpretation: 0-7 suggests no depression, 8-16 suggests mild depression, 17-23 suggests moderate depression and scores over 24 suggest severe depression.

None.name: HAM - Depression - Psychic Component
None.description: Psychic component of the Hamilton Depression Scale (HAM-D). The HAM-D is a clinician-administered depression assessment scale.

None.name: HAM - Depression - Somatic Component
None.description: Somatic component of the Hamilton Depression Scale (HAM-D). The HAM-D is a clinician-administered depression assessment scale.

None.name: PHQ8 - Total
None.description: PHQ: PATIENT HEALTH QUESTIONNAIRE 8-ITEM: Assessment for Mood. 8-item questionnaire used to screen for & assess severity of depressive disorders (higher # = more depressive symptoms)

None.name: PHQ9 - Total
None.description: PHQ: PATIENT HEALTH QUESTIONNAIRE 9-ITEM: Assessment for Mood

None.name: RSAS - Total
None.description: Score for the Revised Social Anhedonia Scale (RSAS).

None.name: SAS - Total
None.description: The Starkstein apathy scale (SAS) has been reported to be the optimal psychological tool for the assessment of apathy in patients. 14 and 18 item versions are available

TAS-20 (Toronto Alexithymia Scale).name: TAS-20 - Total
TAS-20 (Toronto Alexithymia Scale).description: The Toronto Alexithymia Scale (TAS-20) is a 20-item, self-administered questionnaire that measures difficulty in identifying and describing emotions, which is a big part of alexithymia.

None.name: Two Point Discrimination - Index Finger
None.description: Two point discrimination test for sensory discrimination of two points Normal - less than 6mm. Fair - 6 to 10mm. Poor - 11 to 15mm. Protective - one point perceived. Anesthetic - no points perceived.

None.name: Two Point Discrimination - Little Finger
None.description: Two point discrimination test for sensory discrimination of two points Normal - less than 6mm. Fair - 6 to 10mm. Poor - 11 to 15mm. Protective - one point perceived. Anesthetic - no points perceived.

None.name: Two Point Discrimination - Thumb
None.description: Two point discrimination test for sensory discrimination of two points Normal - less than 6mm. Fair - 6 to 10mm. Poor - 11 to 15mm. Protective - one point perceived. Anesthetic - no points perceived.

VFHT (von Frey Hair Test).name: VFHT - Affected Side
VFHT (von Frey Hair Test).description: A test done to check for peripheral nerve damage and sensory testing. Sometimes referred to as von Frey hair test (VFHT). The filaments are classified from grade 1 to 5 according to their thickness: 1.65-2.83 = grade 5, 3.22-3.61 = grade 4, 3.84-4.31 = grade 3, 4.56-6.45 = grade 2, and 6.65 = grade 1.
